intro: Aspilia hassleriana, commonly known as the African crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features a dense cluster of white to pale yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Aspilia hassleriana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun conditions.
